letterGrade.description: According to the policy of the board, and upon request of the parent of the student or, when appropriate, the student, the principal, vice principal or director of instruction in charge of a school may grant permission to a student to withdraw from a course or subject.
letterGrade.label: Withdrawn

letterGrade.description: Historical code related to course withdrawals
letterGrade.label: Withdrawn

letterGrade.description: In Progress.  Final letter grade for non-examinable only; Interim letter grade for both examinable and non-examinable.
letterGrade.label: In Progress

letterGrade.description: The student demonstrates excellent or outstanding performance in relation to expected learning outcomes for the course or subject and grade.
letterGrade.label: A

letterGrade.description: The student demonstrates very good performance in relation to expected learning outcomes for the course or subject and grade.
letterGrade.label: B

letterGrade.description: The student demonstrates good performance in relation to expected learning outcomes for the course or subject and grade.
letterGrade.label: C+

letterGrade.description: The student demonstrates satisfactory performance in relation to expected learning outcomes for the course or subject and grade.
letterGrade.label: C

letterGrade.description: The student demonstrates minimally acceptable performance in relation to expected learning outcomes for the course or subject and grade.
letterGrade.label: C-

letterGrade.description: The student has met the learning outcomes set out in the applicable educational program guide for Graduation Transitions. Requirement Met may only be used for Graduation Transitions (GT/GTF). Note: Requirement Met is also currently active as indicator used for LTE10 Assessment results.
letterGrade.label: Requirement Met

letterGrade.description: The student has not demonstrated the minimally acceptable performance in relation to the expected learning outcomes for the course or subject and grade. F (Failed) may only be used as a final letter grade if an "I" (In Progress) letter grade has been previously assigned or the "F" is assigned as a result of failing a provincially examinable course.
letterGrade.label: Failed

letterGrade.description: Used during a strike in 2012 or 2013 to allow schools to report a course in progress to the Ministry (presumably for Interim mark reporting) where no percentage grade was available.  There is no expiry date on this letter grade to allow its (re)use if needed.
letterGrade.label: No Mark

letterGrade.description: This code was added to BCeSIS in approximately 2006 (and carried over into MyEducation BC) to assist Distributed Learning schools to differentiate those students who did not complete the course for unknown reasons from those who changed courses or specified reasons beyond the student's or school's control (death, serious illness, significant family complications). However, the code has not been used consistently by Distributed Learning schools and has also been picked up in other school types.
letterGrade.label: Withdrawn with Reason

letterGrade.description: Although completion of normal requirements is not possible, a sufficient level of performance has been attained to warrant, consistent with the best interests of the student, the granting of standing for the course or subject and grade. Standing Granted may be used in cases of serious illness, hospitalization, late entry or early leaving, but may only be granted by an adjudication process authorized by the principal, vice principal or director of instruction in charge of the school.
letterGrade.label: Standing Granted

letterGrade.description: May be granted by the principal, vice principal or director of instruction in charge of a school on the basis of an examination of records from an institution other than a school as defined in the School Act. Alternatively, the principal, vice principal or director of instruction in charge of a school may assign a letter grade on the basis of an examination of those records.
letterGrade.label: Transfer Standing

letterGrade.description: The student, for a variety of reasons, is not demonstrating minimally acceptable performance in relation to the expected learning outcomes. An "I" letter grade may only be assigned in accordance with section 3 of the Provincial Letter Grade Order.
letterGrade.label: In Progress or Incomplete

letterGrade.description: Note: “P” was used instead of “C-” to indicate a passing letter grade prior to September 1994.
letterGrade.label: P

algorithmRuleCode.label: Incomplete Courses rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Checks if the student achievement record (e.g., course) session date has passed (e.g. earlier than today - YYYYMM)  and no final result or special case exists.

algorithmRuleCode.label: Incomplete Assessments rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Checks if the student achievement record (e.g. assessment) session date has passed (e.g. earlier than today - YYYMM) and no final result or special case exists.

algorithmRuleCode.label: Course Registrations rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Checks if the student achievement record (e.g., course) session date is still current or future dated (e.g. from today YYYYMM) or later) and no final result or special case exists.

algorithmRuleCode.label: Assessment Registrations rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Checks if the student achievement record (e.g. assessment) session date is still current or future dated (e.g., from today YYYYMM) or later) and no final result or special case exists.

algorithmRuleCode.label: Registration Duplicate Course Rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Checks if there are duplicate in progress courses

algorithmRuleCode.label: Registration Duplicate Assessment Rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Checks if there are duplicate in progress assessments

algorithmRuleCode.label: Registration Failed Course Rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Checks if there are failed in progress courses

algorithmRuleCode.label: Failed Courses rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Based on letter grade table or special case table showing which letter grades or special case are deemed a pass vs fail

algorithmRuleCode.label: Failed Assessments rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Based on letter grade table or special case table showing which letter grades or special case are deemed a pass vs fail

algorithmRuleCode.label: Excluded courses after Program Expiry Date rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Exclude any courses taken after the program has expired

algorithmRuleCode.label: Duplicate Courses rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: If duplicate course code and course level the course with the highest number of credits, highest final %, earliest session date is used

algorithmRuleCode.label: Duplicate Assessments rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: If duplicate assessment code and the assessment with the highest proficiency score, highest special case,earliest ssion date is used

algorithmRuleCode.label: Adult Career Program Courses rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Career Preparation (“CP”) courses are not eligible for 1950 program even though they are reported on the transcript

algorithmRuleCode.label: Locally Developed Courses rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Locally Developed (LD – “X”) courses are not eligible for graduation program even though they are reported on the transcript

algorithmRuleCode.label: Board/Authority Authorized Courses rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Board/Authority Authorized (BAA) courses are not eligible for 1950 program even though they are reported on the transcript

algorithmRuleCode.label: Independent Directed Studies Courses rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Independent Directed Studies (IDS) courses are not eligible for 1950 program even though they are reported on the transcript

algorithmRuleCode.label: Restricted Courses rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: If course is restricted against another course the course with the highest number of credits, highest final %, earliest session date is used

algorithmRuleCode.label: Remove 2-Credit Courses rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Remove courses with less than 4 credits for Adult Grad Program

algorithmRuleCode.label: Match Credits rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Student must meet a minimum of 4-credits from each of the specified non-elective subject areas

algorithmRuleCode.label: AdultWorkExperienceRule
algorithmRuleCode.description: A Student should not have more than 1 work experience course if graduating prior to 201409

algorithmRuleCode.label: Min Elective 12 Credits rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Student must meet a minimum of 8 elective credits

algorithmRuleCode.label: Min Elective 12 Other Credits rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Student must meet a minimum of 4 credit level 12 course or a Social Studies level 11

algorithmRuleCode.label: Min Adult Courses After 19 rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Of the five courses required for the Adult Dogwood, at least three must be completed after a student has turned 19  if a student’s projected grade date is < 2012/07

algorithmRuleCode.label: Min Adult Courses After 18 rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Of the five courses required for the Adult Dogwood, at least three must be completed after a student has turned 18 if a student’s projected grade date is > = 2012/07

algorithmRuleCode.label: No Rule for Optional Programs
algorithmRuleCode.description: Graduate Student's Optional Program without rules

algorithmRuleCode.label: Main Program Complete Rule
algorithmRuleCode.description: Checks if the main program of the student is complete or not

graduatedMessage.gradMainMessage: Based on the information provided by the school, this student has graduated in the %s.
graduatedMessage.honourNote: Based on the information provided by the school, this student has graduated in the %s with Honours.
graduatedMessage.adIBProgramMessage: This student has also participated in: %s
graduatedMessage.programCadre: This student has also successfully completed the %s Program
graduatedMessage.careerProgramMessage: This student has participated in Career Program(s): %s
graduatedMessage.gradProjectedMessage: Based on the information provided by the school, this student should be able to graduate on the %s
graduatedMessage.honourProjectedNote: Based on the information provided by the school, this student should be able to graduate on the %s with honours

nonGraduateMessage.gradMainMessage: Based on the information provided by the school, this student has not yet graduated in the  %s. Students with questions should contact their schools immediately.
nonGraduateMessage.adIBProgramMessage: This student is also participating in: %s
nonGraduateMessage.programCadre: This student is also participating in the %s Program
nonGraduateMessage.careerProgramMessage: This student is participating in Career Program(s): %s
nonGraduateMessage.gradProjectedMessage: Based on the information provided by the school, this student cannot satisfy the requirements for the %s.
